Sequence Information.Peptide Name: PaLEAP-2 (P. altivelis liver-expressed antimicrobial peptide 2; natural AMPs; fish, animals; 2S=S; UCSS1a)
Sequence Information.Source: liver, intestine, a teleost fish,Plecoglossus altivelis

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: The sequence of this entry is 76.2% SIMILAR TOAP1646.Induced and constitutive expression: It is constitutively expressed and can also be induced upon bacterial treatment.Activity: Active against primarily Gram- bacteria  V. vulnificus ATCC 279562 (MIC 100 uM), P. putida ATCC9027 (MIC 100 uM), E. coli DH5alpha K12 (MIC 50 uM), E. tarda Et-CD (MIC 6.25 uM), V. alginolyticus ATCC 17749 (MIC 100 uM), and V. anguillarum ATCC 19264 (MIC 6.25 uM). Interestingly, PaLEAP-2 induced hydrolysis of the pET-22b plasmid DNA and bacterium genomic DNA. Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Li HX, Lu XJ, Li CH, Chen J.2015
Literature Information.Title: Molecular characterization of the liver-expressed antimicrobial peptide 2 (LEAP-2) in a teleost fish, Plecoglossus altivelis: Antimicrobial activity and molecular mechanism
